logic.assemblyline

Class AssemblyLine

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.assemblyline.AssemblyLine

  • public class AssemblyLine
extends java.lang.Object
    Class handling an assembly line of a car manufacturing company.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AssemblyLine()
      Initializes the workstations, the schedule, the statistics and the queue containing the orders.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addOrder(Order order)
      Calls the schedule and asks to schedule the given car order.
      void changeStrategy(Order order)
      Changes the strategy if possible.
      boolean checkPhaseDuration(int phaseDuration)
      Returns true if the given phase duration does not cause the day to change to the next day after 6 am, false otherwise.
      boolean doTask(Task task)
      Completes the task corresponding to the given task.
      java.util.List<Task> getAllTasks(Workstation station)
      Returns a list of all tasks at a given workstation.
      java.util.List<Order> getBachList()
      Returns a list of orders which qualify for batch processing strategy.
      org.joda.time.DateTime getCurrentTime()
      Returns the current time of the system.
      java.util.List<Task> getRequiredTasks(Workstation station)
      Returns a list of pending tasks at a given workstation.
      java.lang.String getStatistics()
      Returns a string containing the representation of the statistics.
      java.util.List<SchedulingStrategy> getStrategies()
      Returns a list of the current strategies followed by the available scheduling strategies.
      java.util.List<Workstation> getWorkStations()
      Asks a list of available workstations.
      boolean tryMoveAssemblyLine(int phaseDuration)
      Returns true if the assembly line can be moved, false otherwise.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AssemblyLine

        public AssemblyLine()
        Initializes the workstations, the schedule, the statistics and the queue containing the orders. Also sets the current time to January first 2014 at the beginning of the shift.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentTime

        public org.joda.time.DateTime getCurrentTime()
        Returns the current time of the system.
        Returns:
        The current time of the system.

      • getStatistics

        public java.lang.String getStatistics()
        Returns a string containing the representation of the statistics.
        Returns:
        A string containing the representation of the statistics.

      • doTask

        public boolean doTask(Task task)
        Completes the task corresponding to the given task.
        Parameters:
        task - A copy of the task that needs to be completed.
        Returns:
        True if the task is completed successfully. False the task could not be completed.

      • getRequiredTasks

        public java.util.List<Task> getRequiredTasks(Workstation station)
        Returns a list of pending tasks at a given workstation.
        Parameters:
        station - The a copy of the workstation for which the pending tasks are needed.
        Returns:
        A list of tasks that are pending at the given workstation.

      • getAllTasks

        public java.util.List<Task> getAllTasks(Workstation station)
        Returns a list of all tasks at a given workstation.
        Parameters:
        station - The a copy of the workstation for which the tasks are needed.
        Returns:
        A list of tasks at the given workstation.

      • tryMoveAssemblyLine

        public boolean tryMoveAssemblyLine(int phaseDuration)
        Returns true if the assembly line can be moved, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        phaseDuration - The largest time needed for this phase to complete.
        Returns:
        True if the assembly line and workstations can be moved. false otherwise.

      • getStrategies

        public java.util.List<SchedulingStrategy> getStrategies()
        Returns a list of the current strategies followed by the available scheduling strategies.
        Returns:
        a list of the current strategies followed by the available scheduling strategies.

      • getBachList

        public java.util.List<Order> getBachList()
        Returns a list of orders which qualify for batch processing strategy.
        Returns:
        A list of orders which qualify for batch processing strategy.

      • getWorkStations

        public java.util.List<Workstation> getWorkStations()
        Asks a list of available workstations.
        Returns:
        The list containing copies of the workstations.

      • addOrder

        public void addOrder(Order order)
        Calls the schedule and asks to schedule the given car order.
        Parameters:
        order - The car order to be scheduled.

      • changeStrategy

        public void changeStrategy(Order order)
        Changes the strategy if possible. Doesn't change anything if the manager wants to change to the currently used strategy.
        Parameters:
        order - Null if the manager wants to change to FIFO strategy. The example order used in batch processing otherwise.

      • checkPhaseDuration

        public boolean checkPhaseDuration(int phaseDuration)
        Returns true if the given phase duration does not cause the day to change to the next day after 6 am, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        phaseDuration - The phase duration that needs to be checked.
        Returns:
        True if the given phase duration is allowed. False otherwise.
